Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored his 14th goal in the Copa América overall and his first goal in this edition, sealing Argentina's 2-0 victory over Canada.
Julian Alvarez scored the first goal for Argentina in the 22nd minute, breaking through Canadian defense.
Canada had a promising start, creating several attacking chances but failed to capitalize, especially with Jacob Shaffelburg missing two good opportunities.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi looked brighter and fitter in this match compared to the previous one, where he had only 32 touches in a full competitive game.
Ángel Di María was withdrawn from the game knowing his last international appearance would be in the upcoming final.
Canada's progress to the semi-final was impressive, especially considering their class in Concacaf and the rapid improvement under coach Jesse Marsch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at MetLife Stadium in front of more than 80,000 fans in hot and humid conditions.
The game was played on a strangely sandy and uneven surface, which affected the flow of the match.
